main.name: Jackson LeMasters
main.bio: My name is Jackson LeMasters, and I am a graduate of the University of Denverâ€™s Full Stack Developer Bootcamp. Previously, I was a student at University of Northern Colorado working towards a history degree, working part time jobs to get through college. The COVID pandemic changed that plan, and subsequently led me to explore a career in web development. I have worked on a contract position, some freelance gigs, and eventually began working at Trace First as a Junior Software Engineer, utilizing Ruby on Rails and MySQL. I enjoy using Ruby on Rails, MySQL, Bootstrap, and React when coding my projects. However, I also have experience with Node.js, Express.js, HAML/HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Git, Github, MongoDB, TailwindCSS and jQuery. I realize being an experienced web developer encompasses a need for continued learning, and I look forward to the journey ahead. Working professionally, I hope to gain skills that will allow me to utilize my knowledge of programming, while gaining the real-world experience necessary to grow personally and professionally.
main.contactmessage: Please contact me through email, LinkedIn, a phone-call, or this form!

resume.skillmessage: * Each skill level is weighted with 100% being fully confident, 0% being no experience/no confidence.

education.description: Coursework Included: HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, jQuery, Bootstrap, Express.js, Handlebars, React.js, Node.js, Database Theory, MongoDB, MySQL, Git

education.degree: 4 years: History Secondary Education, Political Sciences
education.description: Coursework Included: Researching historical topics and writing research papers. Researching mainly on European history, would commonly be required to read books, reports, other reasearch papers, to help build a powerful argument in my research assignments.

work.title: Junior Software Engineer
work.description: Full Stack engineering utilizing MySQL, Ruby on Rails, HAML, Bootstrap, and jQuery to build and maintain software for tracking animal health.

work.title: Full Stack Web Developer / DevOps
work.description: Utilizing Upwork and other freelancing sites, performed Web Development work for clients. Developed Wordpress/CMS sites, React.js, JavaScript, and HTML/CSS. Also deployed and maintained sites, including first deployments to new domains, and setting up SSL certificates.

work.title: Web Developer
work.description: Create and maintain Wordpress website and plugins, research and develop content for websites, and provide general IT help. Main Project: Immigration Dashboard website, helping individuals immigrate to the United States with the use of a one stop website with all the information they could need. 3 month contract.

projects.title: Friends CRUD Application
projects.info: A friend list application created to help learn Ruby on Rails. Create, update, view, and delete friends to and from the database.

projects.title: React Resume Builder
projects.info: Application to help build quick and customized resumes. Create an account, log in, and add your information necessary for a resume. Built using React, Express, GraphQL, Material-UI, and Mongoose. Personally focused on the front end aspect of the project.

projects.title: Node.js README Generator
projects.info: A README.md generator created using Node.js

projects.title: MySQL Employee Tracker
projects.info: An employee tracker built using MySQL, running in Node.js. Add employees to MySQL database and view current employees.

projects.title: Progressive Budget Tracker
projects.info: An application that allows you to track your deposits and withdrawals whether or not you are connected to the internet.

projects.title: Spotify React Clone
projects.info: A clone of the spotify application built using React.js, Next.js, Middleware, Spotify API, Tailwind, NextAuth, Recoil, and Node. Entire UI built from scratch, and uses the Spotify API to pull your playlist data, songs, images, etc.

projects.title: Turbolinks ToDo App; Rails 7
projects.info: A todo app created with the intention of learning how to utilize turbo streams and tailwind in Rails 7.

projects.title: Fitness Tracker Application
projects.info: A fitness tracker application built using NoSQL, Mongoose, and MongoDB. Use this application to keep track of your exercises and workouts.
